intro: Vilfa nigra, commonly known as black vilfa, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its dark purple to black stems and leaves, which are often covered in a fine, silky hair. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
